wikipedia_page.main:
Darren Simon Harland (born 15 October 1979, Whitby, Yorkshire, England) is an English cricketer.  Harland is a right-handed batsman.
Harland represented the Yorkshire Cricket Board in List A cricket.  His debut List A match came against the Gloucestershire Cricket Board in the second round of the 2002 Cheltenham & Gloucester Trophy which was held in 2001.  From 2001 to 2002, he represented the Board in four List A matches, the last of which came against Northumberland in the second round of the 2003 Cheltenham & Gloucester Trophy which was played in 2002.  In his four List A matches, he scored 38 runs at a batting average of 9.50, with a high score of 16.  In the field he took two catches.He currently plays club cricket for Scarborough, in the Yorkshire ECB County Premier League.
